turns.text: and shes expecting the end of this month and shes the only one that lives near by

turns.text: Well uh what kind of recycling do you have in your area
turns.label: qw

turns.text: Well theyve been trying different things One one of the biggest problems seems to be we dont they dont have anyplace to put some of the things that need recycled
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right now weve recycled glass for ye- be- years because we have glass industry in our community
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh what - which one is that

Owens Um so glass has been recycled for long time Uh we have cycling area set up here at our house the Boy Scouts have and theyve done that for years Uh the stores are recycling their plastic bags now You can take them back in and they have bins to collect those
turns.label: sd^r

turns.text: Uh the aluminum cans They try to do the uh newspapers and uh they had to close their area down because they couldnt sell it They were - what they were doing was shredding it and trying to sell it to farmers for bedding for their animals
and that type of thing And that didnt work but but somebody told me that they were charging as much for it as they did for straw
Which is why they couldnt sell it
you know because the farmers would buy the straw if its you know similar price
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And lets see is there anything else Okay I think by this Fall its going to be required that the town of Clarion which well live nearby will have mandatory recycling started so -
turns.label: ^h

turns.text: Uh mainly the glass the aluminum the plastics -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well it sounds like theyre doing quite bit
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well were working hard on it because were fighting also in our area large hazardous waste incinerator --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- which we do not want built and uh we would like industry to do more before they build these big huge incinerators
And uh we we just feel they should they should offer industry some incentives to do more reducing of their waste products and reusing
turns.label: sd

turns.text: them - because some of those companies that are doing it have save money eventually At first apparently it costs more to get started
But once they get established then its money saving thing
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well our company does some things all of which I couldnt even tell you about I dont know all of them but -

turns.text: Gee my my son works for - no not for that - okay Excuse me go ahead
turns.label: o

turns.text: Well I I was just curious as how you got hooked up with this this speech type of thing

turns.text: Well my son works in uh for the federal government Hes he works in computer laboratory
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh it was through him that that uh -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah Well here at work um each one of us has two trash baskets in our office and one of those is designed for any kind of paper products that um they want to use you know for recycling They cant deal with every type
turns.label: b

turns.text: Uh maybe you could tell me what is the difference between office paper waste and just like newspapers
turns.label: qw

turns.text: Well I guess I dont know specifically except that uh for the paper that they want to recycle they do not want any newspaper um and things like candy wrappers or uh that type of thing Lets see I have list here Um they dont want lunch sacks or brown envelopes uh phone books So there are you know lot of kinds of things that they dont want but then any kind of computer paper letters uh booklets - theyll even take things that are bound
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um and it doesnt all have to be like white Theyll take colored folders
turns.label: sd

turns.text: and and uh even some of those can have plastic tabs on them
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So its its hard to kind of figure out you know which things are the right ones
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I mean I Ill frequently have to look at the list if its something that I dont throw away all the time
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But um they do that and then we use uh different chemicals and things and I know that about how they take care of that sort
turns.label: sd

turns.text: of thing I I dont know all the details
but theyre really on top of that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And there probably some other things that I dont about because were real large company
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I just dont have contact with them
turns.label: sd

turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and they have initiated newspaper recycling --
turns.label: sd

-- and all you have to do is bundle it
Uh all around Dallas there are lot of recycling centers where you can take things sometimes for money --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- um but most of those are real far away from like where I live at any rate
Well it would be inconvenient to in other words to -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Very inconvenient and um its just you know hasnt been very practical to get into lot of those things If they would make it something where they you know would pick it up at the curb or at least make it you know down the street and at the corner
more areas where they would pick it up
Um our grocery store like yours will take the uh plastic bags and theyll also take the the paper bags back
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But um uh you mentioned the uh glass type of stuff The reason I ask you about that is years ago and it it changed names somewhere along the line but um my dad used to work for Knox Glass in

Yeah they were taken over by Glass Containers years ago

turns.text: uh-huh uh-huh I think people are getting more interested and they are more concerned And were just were just real concerned about this incinerator because we really they want to put it right in uh in between two of our main water sheds that feed the Clarion Ri- River
turns.label: b

turns.text: And uh we we just we just dont want it anyplace We feel that we that they should give businesses more incentives to do more recycling and more reduction and and more reuse and all those things that could be done

stuff up And now they want to put it in they burn it and that will make another hazardous dump --
